p: Recent developments in stem cell technology suggest the possibility of using induced pluripotent stem-cell (iPSC) microglia-like cells [as per ( 149)] to assess how influenza infection affects the phenotype of these cells. Potentially, iPSC-derived cerebral organoids [so-called ‘mini brains’ ( 224)] could offer a window into the effects of influenza infection on relevant aspects of neurodevelopment.
